metadata.name: The Place Beyond the Bikes
metadata.description:
I was 9066 km away from my hometown when it went into lockdown.
In my opinion Dutch classical architecture is at it’s prettiest on quiet moments without the distraction of traffic and noise. When I worked as a caretaker I used to start at 6am and bike my way through the city fully taking in it’s beauty. 
That was many years ago and the next time I would see images like this it would be on the news in 2020.

This work symbolises that beauty although I changed the setting to an afternoon where the city is fully alive, yet everybody indoors.
The canal boasts a boat in the center of it, hinting at the characters wishing to command it, the bikes are there yet no cyclist on it. In the distance smoke leaves chimneys. 
A city alive during different times. 

Painted with acrylics on canvas 
Deconstructed in Photoshop 
Animated in After Effects.
Music by me.
